data.title: Great Step into the Victorian Era
data.text:
My wife and I stayed here recently while on a business trip to the area. This was actually our second stay here over the years and we have also had relatives visit on our recommendation. This grand old Victorian home is wonderfully decorated in period antiques. The outdoor gardens are also very comforting.

Our hosts are most engaging and the breakfast is absolutely fantastic. The home is just under 1 mile from main street where and the St. Charles historic district. We enjoyed walking down to the historic area which is filled with delightful shops and restaurants. We will definitely stay here again on future visits to the area.

data.title: Wonderful old home-great decor!
data.text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here!  We were met with pop, wine and snacks in our room when we arrived.  We sat down and enjoyed some "down" time with friends.  The room was a little small but very adequate. There was a jetted tub that was wonderful and a small separate bathroom on the other end of the room Little Annie. 
The entire place is in the process of being sold, so slightly run down.  
But beautiful décor with so much to look at in each room.  The library had so many books and was a quaint little place to settle down with one of them! We sat outside in the morning and the veranda had a very comfortable little swing! However, the front porch could have been cleaner.
The breakfast was to die for-only we could not eat it all!  The frittata was moist and delicious and the bacon was crisp and very tasty!
Ruth was so helpful with directions and so friendly to all of us who stayed there.  So pleasant!
We were close to downtown and a very simple drive to get there with plenty of free parking downtown.  We both loved all the stores and the brick streets.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Seemed to be a good place for the night. It is in the process of being sold and it looks a bit neglected. The innkeeper is lovely, breakfast was good, but for the price of the room, it was not worth it. It is comfortable, bedroom clean and mostly quiet - faces the street. Not one to return to.

data.title: No need to look anywhere else
data.text: A wonderful getaway! Upon arrival, we were immediately made to feel at home. Everything was so elegant, but at the same time cozy. The decor through out the home was amazing. Every time we entered a room, something else caught our eye. Beautifully kept! Very clean. John was very quick to offer a hand in anything needed. Ruth could not have been any sweeter. We so enjoyed her chats at breakfast. Speaking of breakfast- OH MY!! Sinfully delicious. It really set the bar for future expectations if we have to stay somewhere else (which we do not plan to.) The jetted tub and a borrowed book from the library downstairs was a perfect way to wind down. The location was also great. Off the beaten path just enough, but within minutes of anything you could want to do. Our next visit will hopefully be "in season" of the beautiful garden out back. The lit up gazebo looked like another great place to just "enjoy". An all around lovely experience!!

data.title: Outstanding B & B
data.text: We've stayed here 3 times now and in each of the 3 rooms. It is like staying in a museum, it is absolutely beautiful.  Ruth the Inn Keeper is like family and you will find her to be very professional and friendly.  Her breakfast is served hot, fresh and you will get plenty to eat.  One time we stayed, we were the only couple so she asked what I would like for breakfast, she would fix me anything I wanted.  I thought this was very kind and thoughtful.  I love good old down home country breakfasts so I asked for eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits and gravy.  WOW, it was some of the best I've ever had, I could barely move since I ate so much, I just couldn't stop it was that good.   When we go to St Charles this is the only place I will stay.

data.title: Easy Stay
data.text:
My wife and I stayed here as we had been given a gift certificate to the Raines the previous Christmas.  We used our two nights here as a working retreat, so we stayed in the house all day long.  It was a great stay.  Breakfast was amazing.  We had the whole house to ourselves so that was cool.  We stayed in the Lady Emily suite.  It has its own bathroom, but only a bath and not a shower.  No problem, they let use the shower in the hall.  

Parking is in the alley way behind the house.  Easy parking once you know where it is.
 
We are  in our late 30s/early 40s.

data.title: Wonderful bed and breakfast!
data.text: We had a wonderful two night say at Raines Victorian Inn.  Ruth is very hospitable and a wonderful cook.  Her house is very clean and inviting. We thoroughly enjoyed the delicious breakfast food.  She gave us our privacy but was also very willing to talk to us when we asked questions about her home and the area.  She suggested some wonderful places for dinner and we had a fabulous time.  St. Charles is a delightful place and we felt very relaxed at the end or our mini-vacation.  We highly recommend Raines Victorian Inn and we would definitely stay there again.

data.title: Super clean and comfortable
data.text: We were looking to bike on the Katy Trail and visit some wineries, so this bed & breakfast was a good location for us.  We have stayed at many B&Bs, and would say that Raines Victorian Inn is one of the best for several reasons.  Ruth is a fabulous inn-keeper, the food she made for breakfast was abundant and extraordinary, the rooms were very clean.  Our room, which was the "Lady Edith" had a small refrigerator which was automatically restocked each day, and clean towels added.  You can see there was much attention to detail to make the stay enjoyable for all.  Downtown St. Charles is a lovely shopping and dining destination in the area with cobblestone streets. Definitely would recommend this warm B&B to our friends.

data.title: This place is gorgeous!
data.text: My husband and I stayed here for our one year anniversary and had a great time. Ruth is very hospitable and her grandson John is hilarious! Our room (The Lady Emily Suite) was beautiful even with the low ceilings on either side. Ruth is an excellent cook, we both thoroughly enjoyed the breakfasts we ate here. We are looking forward to going back in the future!

data.title: Great place to stay and wonderful breakfast
data.text: My husband and I stayed at the Inn for 2 mights while biking the Katy Trail. Ruth was a wonderful hostess and we felt welcome. Breakfast was huge and very tasty. The other visitors were friendly and overall we had a great stay. I will note the room we stayed had a private bath vs a bath within the room. I didn't catch that until check in. I probably would chosen another suite at the Inn if I had looked a little closer at the details. It did not put a damper on our visit. We also enjoyed the food and beer at the Trailhead brewery!

data.title: Fabulous Honeymoon Getaway
data.text: My husband and I stayed at this Bed and Breakfast for 2 nights at the start of our honeymoon last year. It is a gorgeous house and the room we were in, Lady Edith, was elegant and luxurious. I really appreciated how clean it was and how they came in to 'tidy up' during the day. Ruth was a lovely person to speak with and her breakfast was delicious. Overall it was a delightful experience that I will always remember. I am hoping that we will get to come back and visit many times for anniversaries to come. It was sweet that we were also given mugs with the B&B printed on them. A perfect keepsake to always remember the experience!

data.title: An amazing retreat
data.text: We (my husband, mother, and stepfather) just returned from our second stay at Raines.  We are planning on making it an annual trip...bike the katy trail, visit some wineries, and of course stay at Raines Victorian Inn!  Ruth is wonderful, and the setting is beautiful.  It is so quiet and peaceful, the beds almost too comfortable, and the breakfasts delicious!  There are mini fridges in all of the rooms stocked with soda, water, wine & beer, yummy locally made candies left for you each day, and even fresh baked chocolate chip cookies :)  Ruth is very personable and welcoming, making the whole experience so positive...we are hooked on B&B's all because of our first stay here!  I highly reccommend it!!!

data.title: Great Choice for our 18th Anniversary!!
data.text: As innkeepers ourselves, we enjoy visiting B&Bs. We found Ruth and Harley to be delightful. The house is historic, wonderfully decorated and comfortable. We stayed in the Lady Edith 1st floor room, which was comfy, pretty and quiet, and we both slept well. We were treated to a fabulous breakfast in the morning! WOW!! Ruth prepares a delicious meal, with generous portions. Everything was YummO! She also has a very attractive yard where is it nice to relax. We can't imagine a better choice in St Charles. If you're wondering who Harley is...he's her canine companion. He's a black Corgi and is absolutely one of the greatest little guys. He reminded us of our buddy Weagle, so we enjoyed his company a great deal. Thanks Ruth (and Harley) for making our stay everything we had hoped, with nice memories for our 18th Anniversary. All the Best to you in your innkeeping endeavors. You are truly an asset to Bed and Breakfast Inns of Missouri (BBIM).
